thread.title: Ayushmann Khurrana: I keep wearing the same three pairs over and over again
thread.title_full: Ayushmann Khurrana: I keep wearing the same three pairs over and over again - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Ayushmann Khurrana: I keep wearing the same three pairs over and over again
text:
Celebrities talk about what they should throw out during a marathon spring clean-up.
PRIYANKA CHOPRA: IN THE JEAN JUNCTION
One of the two things I will never let go of are the handwritten letters my father (Dr Ashok Chopra) wrote to me. It's in the same font that I have tattooed to my hand.The second is a large solitaire ring, gifted by him, which I wear, often. He would joke that the man I wanted to marry had to beat this ring.These apart, I will happily get rid of my old, worn jeans that are out of fashion now... And the ripped Tees which were once a fad!
TAAPSEE PANNU: COAT UNCOAT
I have treasured a long, white, oversized coat since my college years. I've moved from Delhi to Mumbai and back over a dozen times, but strangely, I never remember to bring it with me. I don't remember to take it out during Delhi winters and since it's hardly cold in Mumbai, it's just been lying in the cupboard. Now, that it is out of fashion and I can let it go!
AYUSHMANN KHURRANA: TEE OFF
My mom has a crazy habit. She will holler, every now and then, "Clean out the almari", and it's time for spring cleaning. I have around 15 Tees and a dozen denims, but I keep wearing the same three pairs over and over again. When I was packing for my Maroon 5 concert recently, I found a Tee I'd bought and completely forgotten about. And it made me realise mom was right, it was time to empty the wardrobe.
READ: â€‹Priyanka Chopra to romance Fawad Khan
ABHAY DEOL: UNDER KI BAAT
Torn underwear, for sure!
HUGH JACKMAN: CRYING WOLF
My wife (Deborra-Lee Furness) and I had a disa greement when I signed up for the role of X-Men's Wolverine in 2000. Deb thought it was a terrible idea because it's very self-indulgent, all about me. It was the only time I proved her wrong. I've been Wolverine for so long. But I think I'll need to get rid of my wolf-syndrome next year.Tom Hardy would be a great replacement!
KONKANA SEN SHARMA: MY DEAR DIARY
I`ve never kept a journal or diary in particular, but I have a notebook since class 11 whose pages are now dog-eared, with Plato-notes from college, some math problems, lyrics by Alanis Morissette and a few other songs penned down from my 20s. There are things I don't even understand anymore, like little notes a friend and I passed between class.Also, e-words, that I did not know the meaning of then. I haven't updated the notebook in years. May be it's time to give up on it now!
RAJKUMMAR RAO: SHOE OFF NOW
I`ve walked the whole of Europe in an amaz ing pair of comfortable shoes. They are close to my heart but worn out now. I think I'll give them away. But I will never throw away my pen from Shahid and the watch which is a memento of CityLights.
ADITI RAO HYDARI: PACK UP
My mom gave me a silver key chain when I left for boarding school. It had my trunk and cupboard keys and a beautiful old coin with Persian calligraphy on it.I'll never get rid of that but I think I can discard some of the clothes from that trunk and cupboard now.
